name: Holiday Inn Resort Vanuatu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at Vanuatu and had a great time at your establishment.
reviews.title: GREAT HOLIDAY

reviews.text: The staff were wonderful and nothing was too much trouble. The food was great and the setting is sublime, even the crabholes on the golf course were fun. The people of this country are so friendly and only too happy to answer questions and assistance.We will certainly visit again.
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 4 nights in April with our 2 children (6 yrs and 9 yrs). We were unable to book a family suite, which was a pity because in photos they look great, so we stayed in a standard room. It was a little ‘cosy’ with 4 of us in the room but there was plenty of cupboard, shelf and drawer space, so at least we didn’t feel we were constantly tripping over things. The room was very modern and bright and super clean. We had lagoon view room – worth the extra money as it’s a lovely outlook.
reviews.title: Quiet and relaxing paradise

reviews.text: Holiday Inn is definitely kid-friendly. Ours adored it – they loved the pool, the ice cream, the kayaking, the puzzles and colouring-in on the kids’ menus in the restaurant and above all they LOVED (capital letters required) the fire dancing. They both said it was the best thing they saw in Vanuatu. We only booked them into Kids Club for one session but both of them enjoyed their afternoon there.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn is great

reviews.text: The food is good but a few more vegetarian choices on the dinner menu would have been appreciated. Do yourself and favour and try the Banana Choc-o-Lada mocktail - just sublime!
reviews.title: Absoultely Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, staff were very friendly and accommodating, even after we did the buggy tour and were covered in mud it wasn't an issue to clean our muddy clothes.
reviews.title: Vanuatu Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute we arrived they were giving us advice on where to go and what the best places around town were. The hotel is a little bit out from the middle of town but the taxi's/buses were only a few dollars and were always waiting out the front anyway.
reviews.title: Great place to time out

reviews.text: Food at the hotel was a little pricey compared to going into Port Villa but was quite nice so we didn't mind paying more for it.
reviews.title: Travel with kids - family suite

reviews.text: Heaps to do within the resort, the pool bar was great to have a few drinks and relax.
reviews.title: Excellent, you won't want to leave

reviews.text: Kava ceremony was great!
reviews.title: One word... AMAZING!

reviews.text: I have just returned from a holiday here and i cannot wait to go back.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort with wonderful staff

reviews.text: You are in the middle of town with the feeling of seclusion.
reviews.title: Bond

reviews.title: Delightful
reviews.text: My friends and I would have cocktails next to the lagoon, dinner on the verandah.
Food was amazing. So easy to get into town.
reviews.title: Top marks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 6 nights at The Holiday Inn Resort. We enjoyed Room 161 with its view over the garden pool area. beautiful outlook each morning. We found the staff very helpful, particularly Taneal and Mark (Food & Beverage Manager). We had a couple of issues with breakfast the first two days but after a word with Mark it was quickly resolved. A great place to relax, enjoy the lagoon, walk around the property. I would highly recommend this Resort to families with young children, Two pools and activities centre for little ones. Could not fault it. Would not hesitate to return.
reviews.title: A Perfect Place to Relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the start and finish of our trip to Vanuatu while waiting to connect with flights to the outer islands. This used to be the Le Meridien Vanuatu but has been converted into a Holiday Inn Resort.
reviews.title: Good for families and groups
Perfect Holiday Paradise
reviews.text: Getting from the airport is easy, just get a taxi for 2000Vt but make sure you confirm the price before getting in - It's about a 20 minute drive over good roads. To get into the town centre a taxi costs 500Vt, and if you can flag down a minibus it's 150Vt per person. Check-in on the first occasion was simple and I think we were in our room in under five minutes. On the 2nd occasion there was a problem with the credit card facilities so we had to leave the deposit in cash (AUD$50).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room we had was a lagoon facing one on the ground floor and was well fitted out but there was a strong musty smell. We would probably have asked to change rooms if it hadn't been midnight, and as it was only three nights in total we just put up with it - never did get used to the smell though. The 2nd room was on the 1st floor and didn't have any smell so was much better. The rooms look to be recently renovated, and the only other thing I could fault was that there was mould in both the bathrooms we used.
reviews.title: Exceeded our Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are quite nice and the main pool looks good, but was much colder than the ocean temperature so we only tried it once. The golf course was very rough but fun for a hack around to pass some time. The resort is really set-up more for families and groups than for couples, hence there are lots of activities and large eating areas - definitely no intimate restaurants.
reviews.title: Absolute relaxing quality service for a 10 day holiday

description: Overlooking the serene waters of the Erakor Lagoon, Holiday Inn Resort Vanuatu is set in vibrant natural surroundings. Meaning “the land that always existed”, Vanuatu is a holiday destination made up of 83 tropical islands located northeast of New Caledonia. Immersed in cultural richness and native splendour, the islands hold crystal blue beaches, coral reefs, hot springs, exotic rainforests, and stunning waterfalls that are some of the most beautiful in the world. The Vanuatu hotel’s Erakor Ballroom and Valea meeting space provides exceptional indoor and outdoor meeting facilities, and the accommodation resort also features a unique Namele Day Spa, two luxurious outdoor holiday swimming pools, and the newly refurbished Palms Casino. The views from the rooms include lush gardens, blue lagoons, and a golf course. The hotel boasts 5 dining areas. Breakfast, buffet and à la carte dinners are served daily. There is an extensive wine list from New Zealand, Australia and France. Get to experience the perfect Vanuatu holiday with island lifestyle at Holiday Inn Resort Vanuatu.
